result.name: 2012-scottish-natural-heritage-snh-biological-analyses-of-marine-scotland-science-mss-loch-erib1
result.notes: The purpose of this benthic survey in Loch Eriboll was to improve knowledge of the occurrence and distribution of species and habitats of recognised conservation importance, particularly priority marine features (PMFs). A further aim was to assess the implications of renewable energy developments on the features of importance. An underwater video survey was conducted by MSS for MSS on the 8-9th March 2012 to collect detailed biological information on the seabed species and habitat features present. Drop-down video drift tows were undertaken at 14 sites. Analyses on the seabed video and still photographic imagery, commissioned by SNH, were used to describe the nature of the seabed in terms of the physical structure and the species assemblages.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: 2012 Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH) biological analyses of Marine Scotland Science (MSS) Loch Eribol benthic camera survey

extras.value: ["Not for navigational use; This survey recorded no species or biotope occurrences that SNH consider as sensitive; all records may therefore be released in response to requests covered by Environmental Information Regulations or Freedom of Information Regulations; additionally its re-use and dissemination is permissible under Open Government Licence terms. Any re-use of this data will acknowledge the copyright owner."]
Colin Moore (originator); Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH), Headquaters (custodian)
